"}, {"content": "The victims of the pipe bomb explosion at the Ariana Grande concert in Manchester, England, on May 22, 2017, were mostly young girls and boys. The victims were mostly from the United Kingdom, but there were also victims from other countries, including Iran.

The Iranian friend of the Icelandic friend was injured in the bombing. The friend was standing near the stage when the pipe bomb exploded, and was injured by shrapnel. The friend was treated for their injuries at the scene and later released from the hospital.

The Icelandic friend of the Iranian friend was not injured in the bombing. The friend was standing near the stage when the pipe bomb exploded, but was able to escape the area before the explosion occurred.

The pipe bomb was detonated by a terrorist who had been radicalized by extremist Islamic ideology. The attack was carried out in the name of the extremist group ISIS.
